Posted By: Goatllama (7/17/2013 8:54:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ah, it feels so good to have a true restriction on a black kill spell again. I know some hate it, but I really think it's cool that some black magic simply doesn't work on black.   
  
No [Banishing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banishing), no Doom, no [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror) is enough on a [Lord of the Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Pit), he comes from a place of Doom, Terror, and Banishment, which is exactly how I feel it should be.  
  
Either way, glad it's back; I also happen to think the platinum uncommon symbol really looks good against all that black :)
posts.html:

No Banishing, no Doom, no Terror is enough on a Lord of the Pit, he comes from a place of Doom, Terror, and Banishment, which is exactly how I feel it should be.

Either way, glad it's back; I also happen to think the platinum uncommon symbol really looks good against all that black :)

Posted By: Goatllama (7/17/2013 8:54:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
if this is considered Uncommon, I wouldn't be surprised if [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror) comes back eventually to play 'Shock' to Doom Blade's [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt). This is likely going to be considered Uncommon forever now. If it gets a Common reprint in the next two years, I'll be wrong.  
  
  
But if it doesn't, two more Uncommon prints would be enough proof in my book to show they mean it. I would then actively search out original M10 Foils. They won't, like, go super crazy or anything, but going up even by just say, a couple of dollars (up to maybe $4-5?) would be enough to make a decent profit If you grab them all up now for 15 cents.
posts.html:

But if it doesn't, two more Uncommon prints would be enough proof in my book to show they mean it. I would then actively search out original M10 Foils.
